questions.name: sep
questions.help:
You have two options for placing the build directory for Sphinx output.
Either, you use a directory '_build' within the root path, or you separate
'source' and 'build' directories within the root path.

questions.name: dot
questions.message: Name prefix for templates and static dir
questions.help:
Inside the root directory, two more directories will be created; '_templates'
for custom HTML templates and '_static' for custom stylesheets and other static
files. You can enter another prefix (such as '.') to replace the underscore.

questions.name: project
questions.help: The project name will occur in several places in the built documentation.

questions.name: version
questions.help: Sphinx has the notion of a 'version' and a 'release' for the software. Each version can have multiple releases. For example, for Python the version is something like 2.5 or 3.0, while the release is something like 2.5.1 or 3.0a1. If you don't need this dual structure, just set both to the same value.

questions.name: suffix
questions.help: The file name suffix for source files. Commonly, this is either '.txt' or '.rst'.  Only files with this suffix are considered documents.

questions.name: master
questions.message: Name of your master document (without suffix)
questions.help: One document is special in that it is considered the top node of the 'contents tree', that is, it is the root of the hierarchical structure of the documents. Normally, this is 'index', but if your 'index' document is a custom template, you can also set this to another filename.

questions.name: epub
questions.help: Sphinx can also add configuration for epub output:

questions.name: ext_doctest
questions.help: Automatically test code snippets in doctest blocks

questions.name: ext_intersphinx
questions.help: Link between Sphinx documentation of different projects

questions.name: ext_todo
questions.help: Write 'todo' entries that can be shown or hidden on build

questions.name: ext_pngmath
questions.help: Include math, rendered as PNG images

questions.name: ext_mathjax
questions.help: Include math, rendered in the browser by MathJax

questions.name: ext_ifconfig
questions.help: Conditional inclusion of content based on config values

questions.name: ext_viewcode
questions.help: Include links to the source code of documented Python objects
